original: de nas phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor thog thag tu sa dang bsres pa'i ba'i lci bas dkyil 'khor byas la dri chab kyis bskus te tshon sna lnga'i srad bus thig btab la sgo bzhi rnam par phye ste seng ldeng gi phur bu tshad sor bcu gnyis pa drug
analyzed: de nas phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor thog thag tu sa dang bsres pa'i ba'i lci bas dkyil 'khor byas la dri chab kyis bskus te tshon sna lnga'i srad bus thig btab la sgo bzhi rnam par phye ste seng ldeng gi phur bu tshad sor bcu gnyis pa drug
translated: Then, in the outer maṇḍala, one should make a maṇḍala with cow dung mixed with clay, anoint it with perfumed water, draw lines with five-colored thread, open the four doors, and plant six vajra-daggers of khadira wood, twelve finger-widths long,

original: cu rtsa bzhi gdab bo //
analyzed: cu rtsa bzhi gdab bo //
translated: One should draw thirty-four.

original: tshon sna lnga'i srad bus dkyil 'khor kun tu bskor bar bya'o //🔽bum bu dang / bum pa dang / bya ma bum drug cu rtsa bzhi'i gtor ma sna tshogs kyis bkang ba bzhag go /
analyzed: tshon sna lnga'i srad bus dkyil 'khor kun tu bskor bar bya'o // bum bu dang / bum pa dang / bya ma bum drug cu rtsa bzhi'i gtor ma sna tshogs kyis bkang ba bzhag go /
translated: One should encircle the maṇḍala with a string of five colors.🔽One should place sixty-four vases, water pots, and clay pots filled with various bali offerings.

original: kham phor zlum po drug cu rtsa bzhi gtor ma sna tshogs kyis bkang ba gzhag go /
analyzed: kham phor zlum po drug cu rtsa bzhi gtor ma sna tshogs kyis bkang ba gzhag go /
translated: One should place sixty-four round clay bowls filled with various bali offerings.

original: gtor ma tshul sna tshogs pa drug cu rtsa bzhi so sor gzhag go /
analyzed: gtor ma tshul sna tshogs pa drug cu rtsa bzhi so sor gzhag go /
translated: One should place sixty-four individual bali offerings of various types.

original: snod tshon sna lnga pa drug cu rtsa bzhi kha zas rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bkang ba dang / bca' ba rnam pa sna tshogs blugs pa dang / gtor ma dkar po rnam pa sna tshogs gzhag go /
analyzed: snod tshon sna lnga pa drug cu rtsa bzhi kha zas rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bkang ba dang / bca' ba rnam pa sna tshogs blugs pa dang / gtor ma dkar po rnam pa sna tshogs gzhag go /
translated: One should place sixty-four vessels of five colors filled with various foods, various baked goods, and various white bali offerings.

original: yo byad thams cad kyis yongs su gang ba ro rnam pa sna tshogs kyi @11a *//🔽gtor ma gzhag go /
analyzed: yo byad thams cad kyis yongs su gang ba ro rnam pa sna tshogs kyi @11a *// gtor ma gzhag go /
translated: One should place a bali of various tastes filled with all articles.

original: 'bras bu sna tshogs dang / me tog sna tshogs dgram mo //
analyzed: 'bras bu sna tshogs dang / me tog sna tshogs dgram mo //
translated: One should scatter various fruits and various flowers.

original: phreng ba brgya nyi shu rtsa gcig dkyil 'khor du dpyang bar bya ste /
analyzed: phreng ba brgya nyi shu rtsa gcig dkyil 'khor du dpyang bar bya ste /
translated: One should hang one hundred and twenty-one rosaries in the maṇḍala.

original: byang phyogs kyi dkyil 'khor la drug cu rtsa bzhi /
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi dkyil 'khor la drug cu rtsa bzhi /
translated: In the northern maṇḍala, there are sixty-four.

original: snying po'i dkyil 'khor la sum cu rtsa gnyis gdags so //
analyzed: snying po'i dkyil 'khor la sum cu rtsa gnyis gdags so //
translated: In the central maṇḍala, there are thirty-two.

original: me mar gyi sdong bu bzhi bud par bya'o //
analyzed: me mar gyi sdong bu bzhi bud par bya'o //
translated: Four oil lamps should be lit.

original: gtor ma brgya drug cu rtsa bzhi dang / dkyil 'khor thog thag tu mar me bud par bya'o //
analyzed: gtor ma brgya drug cu rtsa bzhi dang / dkyil 'khor thog thag tu mar me bud par bya'o //
translated: One should place one hundred and sixty-four bali offerings and lamps all around the maṇḍala.

original: chang dang / sha dang / peg tsong dang / sgog skya dang / ke'u dang / tshod sngon dang / la phug spangs pa'i gtor ma gzhan rnam pa sna tshogs gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: chang dang / sha dang / peg tsong dang / sgog skya dang / ke'u dang / tshod sngon dang / la phug spangs pa'i gtor ma gzhan rnam pa sna tshogs gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should place other various kinds of bali offerings, except for those that contain alcohol, meat, onions, garlic, leeks, eggplants, and radishes.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi phyi'i grva bzhir don yod pa'i zhags pa'i mdo sde bklag par bya ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi phyi'i grva bzhir don yod pa'i zhags pa'i mdo sde bklag par bya ste /
translated: In the four corners outside the maṇḍala, one should recite the Amoghapāśa Sūtra.

original: sgo re rer bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: sgo re rer bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bklag par bya'o //
translated: At each door, one should recite the Bhagavatī Prajñāpāramitā.

original: chos klog pa legs par khrus byas te lha rdzas kyi gos kyis dkris te gtsang ma la dri rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bsgos pa'i gos gtsang ma gsar pa bgos te chos kyi stan shin tu brgyan pa lha rdzas kyi stan la 'dug nas tshig 'jam po tshig
analyzed: chos klog pa legs par khrus byas te lha rdzas kyi gos kyis dkris te gtsang ma la dri rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bsgos pa'i gos gtsang ma gsar pa bgos te chos kyi stan shin tu brgyan pa lha rdzas kyi stan la 'dug nas tshig 'jam po tshig
translated: Having bathed well, he should wrap the Dharma text in divine cloth, and having put on a new, clean garment that is perfumed with various fragrances, he should sit on a Dharma seat that is well-adorned with divine cloth, and with soft,

original: mnyen pos bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: mnyen pos bklag par bya'o //
translated: gentle words, he should recite.

original: nub kyi phyogs cha la dkyil 'khor mthon po la bde ba can gyi bkod pa bris pa 'od dpag med dang / 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug dang / mthu chen thob pa'i gzugs bris pa'i ras kyi sku @11b gzugs dkyil 'khor la mngon du phyogs par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: nub kyi phyogs cha la dkyil 'khor mthon po la bde ba can gyi bkod pa bris pa 'od dpag med dang / 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug dang / mthu chen thob pa'i gzugs bris pa'i ras kyi sku @11b gzugs dkyil 'khor la mngon du phyogs par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the western direction, on a high maṇḍala, he should draw the array of Sukhāvatī, and place a cloth painting of Amitābha, Noble Avalokiteśvara, and Mahāsthāmaprāpta facing the maṇḍala.

original: shar gyi phyogs cha la dkyil 'khor gru bzhi mthon po byas la rnam par grol ba'i dkyil 'khor la sh'akya thub pa dang / 'phags pa rdo rje 'chang ba dang / don yod pa'i zhags pa'i khro bo'i gzugs bris pa ras kyi sku gzugs dkyil 'khor la mngon du phyogs par gzhag go /
analyzed: shar gyi phyogs cha la dkyil 'khor gru bzhi mthon po byas la rnam par grol ba'i dkyil 'khor la sh'akya thub pa dang / 'phags pa rdo rje 'chang ba dang / don yod pa'i zhags pa'i khro bo'i gzugs bris pa ras kyi sku gzugs dkyil 'khor la mngon du phyogs par gzhag go /
translated: In the eastern direction, one should make a high, square maṇḍala, and on the maṇḍala of liberation one should place a cloth painting of Śākyamuni, Noble Vajradhara, and Amoghapāśa in wrathful form, facing the maṇḍala.

original: lho'i phyogs cha la ri 'dra ba'i gnas mthon po byas la de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten dbang phyug rgyal po dang / 'jam dpal dang / sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba dang / don yod pa'i zhags pa ras la bris pa'i dkyil 'khor la mngon du phyogs par gzhag go //
analyzed: lho'i phyogs cha la ri 'dra ba'i gnas mthon po byas la de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten dbang phyug rgyal po dang / 'jam dpal dang / sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba dang / don yod pa'i zhags pa ras la bris pa'i dkyil 'khor la mngon du phyogs par gzhag go //
translated: In the southern direction, one should make a high place like a mountain, and on that one should place a cloth painting of the Tathāgata Lokeśvara-rāja, Mañjuśrī, Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin, and Amoghapāśa facing the maṇḍala.

original: byang gi phyogs cha la khro bo'i rgyal po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad dang / byams pa dang / sa'i snying po bris pa'i ras kyi sku gzugs dkyil 'khor la mngon du phyogs par gzhag go /
analyzed: byang gi phyogs cha la khro bo'i rgyal po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad dang / byams pa dang / sa'i snying po bris pa'i ras kyi sku gzugs dkyil 'khor la mngon du phyogs par gzhag go /
translated: In the northern direction, one should place a painting of Krodharāja, the Tathāgata Vairocana, Maitreya, and Kṣitigarbha.

original: stegs bu'i rnam par mthon por byas pa thams cad legs par brgyan par bya'o //
analyzed: stegs bu'i rnam par mthon por byas pa thams cad legs par brgyan par bya'o //
translated: One should make the platform high and adorn it well.

original: dar gyi phreng bas brgyan par bya'o //
analyzed: dar gyi phreng bas brgyan par bya'o //
translated: It should be adorned with garlands of silk.

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa dang / bum pa gang ba bzhag pa dang / dris dkyil 'khor bya ba dang / ro'i mchog rnam pa sna tshogs bza' ba'i ngo bo rnam pa du ma'i kha zas kyi ro dbul ba dang / 'bras bu rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i bsod @12a *//
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa dang / bum pa gang ba bzhag pa dang / dris dkyil 'khor bya ba dang / ro'i mchog rnam pa sna tshogs bza' ba'i ngo bo rnam pa du ma'i kha zas kyi ro dbul ba dang / 'bras bu rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i bsod @12a *//
translated: It should be adorned with all ornaments, with full vases placed, with incense in the maṇḍala, and with various kinds of food offerings, the essence of which is meat, and various kinds of fruits.

original: snyoms gzhag pa dang / tsandan dang / aa ga ru dang / du ru ka dang / ga pur dang / gla rtsi dang / gur gum dang bsres pa'i bdug pa ras kyi sku gzugs la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: snyoms gzhag pa dang / tsandan dang / aa ga ru dang / du ru ka dang / ga pur dang / gla rtsi dang / gur gum dang bsres pa'i bdug pa ras kyi sku gzugs la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should offer incense to the cloth image, mixed with sandalwood, agarwood, durvā grass, camphor, musk, and saffron.

original: de nas rig sngags 'chang bas dus gsum du khrus bya zhing /
analyzed: de nas rig sngags 'chang bas dus gsum du khrus bya zhing /
translated: Then, the knowledge-mantra holder should bathe three times a day,

original: gos lan gsum brjes te dus gsum du bzlas brjod dang / cho ga bya'o //
analyzed: gos lan gsum brjes te dus gsum du bzlas brjod dang / cho ga bya'o //
translated: change clothes three times a day, and perform the recitations and rituals three times a day.

original: tshes brgyad nas brtsams te tshes bco lnga tshang gi bar du don yod pa'i zhags pa lan nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: tshes brgyad nas brtsams te tshes bco lnga tshang gi bar du don yod pa'i zhags pa lan nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: Beginning on the eighth day, one should recite Amoghapāśa twenty-one times until the fifteenth day is complete.

original: khro bo'i rgyal po lan nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po lan nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: One should recite the Wrathful King twenty-one times.

original: don yod pa'i zhags pa'i lcags kyu nyi shu rtsa gcig dang / don yod pa rnam par lta ba'i zhags pa'i snying po dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par 'phrul pa lan nyi shu rtsa gcig dang / rnam par grol ba'i dkyil 'khor byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis phyag byas pa stong rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod bya ba dang /
analyzed: don yod pa'i zhags pa'i lcags kyu nyi shu rtsa gcig dang / don yod pa rnam par lta ba'i zhags pa'i snying po dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par 'phrul pa lan nyi shu rtsa gcig dang / rnam par grol ba'i dkyil 'khor byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis phyag byas pa stong rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod bya ba dang /
translated: the twenty-one hooks of Amogha-pāśa, the essence of the noose of the all-seeing Amogha-pāśa, the twenty-one emanations of the supramundane [Avalokiteśvara], and the eight thousand recitations of the maṇḍala of liberation worshipped by all bodhisattvas.

original: rnam par grol ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi zhags pa'i snying po stong rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi zhags pa'i snying po stong rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: One should recite the essence of the noose of the maṇḍala of liberation eight thousand times.

original: zla ba nyar thug gi bar du zas dkar gsum bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba nyar thug gi bar du zas dkar gsum bza' bar bya'o //
translated: For a month, one should eat the three white foods.

original: tshes bco lnga'i nyin mtshan thog thag tu don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po dpag tu med par bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: tshes bco lnga'i nyin mtshan thog thag tu don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po dpag tu med par bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: On the fifteenth day, one should recite the essence of Amogha-pāśa continuously throughout the day and night.

original: mtshan thog thag bzlas brjod byas kyang ngal ba med pa dang / lus snyoms @12b pa dang bral bas bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan thog thag bzlas brjod byas kyang ngal ba med pa dang / lus snyoms @12b pa dang bral bas bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: Even if one recites continuously throughout the night, one should recite without fatigue, without the body becoming exhausted.

original: byams pa dang / snying rje'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'i sems su bya'o //
translated: One should have a mind of loving kindness and compassion.

original: bzlas brjod kyi cho ga zin nas dkyil 'khor gyi bya ba mtshams bcad pa dang / phyogs bcing ba dang / bdag srung ba dang / gzhan srung ba dang / dkyil 'khor bsdam pa byas nas de nas 'khor rnams dkyil 'khor du dam tshig la gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: bzlas brjod kyi cho ga zin nas dkyil 'khor gyi bya ba mtshams bcad pa dang / phyogs bcing ba dang / bdag srung ba dang / gzhan srung ba dang / dkyil 'khor bsdam pa byas nas de nas 'khor rnams dkyil 'khor du dam tshig la gzhug par bya'o //
translated: After completing the ritual of recitation, having performed the boundary-enclosing rite of the maṇḍala, binding the directions, self-protection, protection of others, and binding the maṇḍala, one should then induct the retinue into the maṇḍala commitments.

original: dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi las zin nas mchod pa brtsam mo //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi las zin nas mchod pa brtsam mo //
translated: Having inducted them into the maṇḍala and completed the maṇḍala rites, one should commence the offerings.

original: mchod pa'i cho ga zin pa dang / de nas bzlas brjod brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: mchod pa'i cho ga zin pa dang / de nas bzlas brjod brtsam par bya ste /
translated: After completing the offering ritual, one should then commence the recitation.

original: don yod pa'i zhags pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi spyan sngar 'dug nas don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po bzlas brjod byas la khro bo'i rgyal po brgya rtsa brgyad kyis dbang bskur ro; ;bzlas brjod lan nyi shu rtsa gcig dang / dbang bskur ma thag tu ras kyi sku gzugs dang /
analyzed: don yod pa'i zhags pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi spyan sngar 'dug nas don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po bzlas brjod byas la khro bo'i rgyal po brgya rtsa brgyad kyis dbang bskur ro; ;bzlas brjod lan nyi shu rtsa gcig dang / dbang bskur ma thag tu ras kyi sku gzugs dang /
translated: In front of the Amoghapāśa maṇḍala, one should recite the essence mantra of Amoghapāśa and confer empowerment with the one hundred and eight wrathful kings.

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad kun tu 'bar zhing 'od zer sna tshogs 'byin cing legs so zhes bya ba'i sgra 'byin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad kun tu 'bar zhing 'od zer sna tshogs 'byin cing legs so zhes bya ba'i sgra 'byin par 'gyur ro //
translated: As soon as the empowerment is conferred, the cloth image and all the maṇḍalas will blaze with light and emit various light rays, and the sound of “excellent” will be heard.

original: rig sngags 'chang ba'i snying dga' zhing lus 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang ba'i snying dga' zhing lus 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The heart of the knowledge-holder will be delighted and his body will blaze.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug shin tu 'bar zhing 'od 'phro ba nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i 'od zer can don yod pa'i zhags pa tshangs pa'i cha byad 'chang ba dkyil 'khor gyi dbus kyi nang nas mngon du gshegs te @13a *//
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug shin tu 'bar zhing 'od 'phro ba nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i 'od zer can don yod pa'i zhags pa tshangs pa'i cha byad 'chang ba dkyil 'khor gyi dbus kyi nang nas mngon du gshegs te @13a *//
translated: Noble Avalokiteśvara, blazing and radiant, with light rays surpassing a thousand suns, holding the Amoghapāśa and wearing the form of Brahmā, will emerge from within the center of the maṇḍala.

original: phyogs bcu'i dkyil 'khor kun la rnam par gzigs shing rig sngags 'chang ba legs so zhes bya ba'i sgra phyung ste /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i dkyil 'khor kun la rnam par gzigs shing rig sngags 'chang ba legs so zhes bya ba'i sgra phyung ste /
translated: He looked at all the maṇḍalas in the ten directions and uttered the sound “Excellent!” to the vidyādhara.

original: phyag g-yas pa brkyang ste rig sngags 'chang ba'i spyi bo la bzhag ste dkyil 'khor gyi mchog shin tu brgyan cing spras pa 'di ni /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa brkyang ste rig sngags 'chang ba'i spyi bo la bzhag ste dkyil 'khor gyi mchog shin tu brgyan cing spras pa 'di ni /
translated: He extended his right hand, placed it on the vidyādhara’s head, and said, “This supreme maṇḍala, which is well adorned and ornamented,

original: shin tu bzang ba yin te /
analyzed: shin tu bzang ba yin te /
translated: is very good.

original: legs so legs so //
analyzed: legs so legs so //
translated: Excellent, excellent!

original: 'di rnam par grol ba'i dkyil 'khor don yod pa'i zhags pa rnams par 'phrul pa /
analyzed: 'di rnam par grol ba'i dkyil 'khor don yod pa'i zhags pa rnams par 'phrul pa /
translated: This is the maṇḍala of liberation, the manifestation of the unfailing noose,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs pa /
translated: blessed by all tathāgatas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis phyag byas pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis phyag byas pa /
translated: worshipped by all bodhisattvas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi gsang ba /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi gsang ba /
translated: the secret of all tathāgatas and bodhisattvas,

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / srin po rnams kyi dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / srin po rnams kyi dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor /
translated: the maṇḍala of the commitment of gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, and rākṣasas,

original: bdud thams cad pham par byed pa'i dkyil 'khor; bgegs dang / rnam par log 'dren thams cad 'joms pa /🔽bud med dang / skyes pa dang / khye'u dang / bu mo dang / dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / rje'u'i rigs dang / dmangs rigs dang / tha na byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i bya yang rung ste /
analyzed: bdud thams cad pham par byed pa'i dkyil 'khor; bgegs dang / rnam par log 'dren thams cad 'joms pa / bud med dang / skyes pa dang / khye'u dang / bu mo dang / dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / rje'u'i rigs dang / dmangs rigs dang / tha na byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i bya yang rung ste /
translated: the maṇḍala that conquers all māras, and the maṇḍala that destroys all obstructors and opposing forces.🔽It is the maṇḍala that liberates all beings—women, men, boys, girls, ascetics, brahmins, vaiśyas, śūdras, and even animals such as birds—

original: sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i gcong rong las sgrol ba @13b yin no; ;'di ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i gcong rong las sgrol ba @13b yin no; ;'di ni /
translated: from the abyss of saṃsāra.

original: sdig pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad dang / dmyal ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / nad dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba las yongs su thar par byed cing 'jigs pa med pa'i khyim du 'jug par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sdig pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad dang / dmyal ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / nad dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba las yongs su thar par byed cing 'jigs pa med pa'i khyim du 'jug par byed pa yin no //
translated: It liberates from all evil deeds and obscurations, from the hells, from suffering, from disease, from birth, from aging, and from death, and it causes one to enter the house of fearlessness.

original: 'di ni / rnam par thar par byed pa dkyil 'khor chen po snying po dang / gsang sngags su bcas pa rnam par grol ba'i dkyil 'khor byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis phyag byas pa 'di rig sngags 'chang ba de dang des ming brjod pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ni / rnam par thar par byed pa dkyil 'khor chen po snying po dang / gsang sngags su bcas pa rnam par grol ba'i dkyil 'khor byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis phyag byas pa 'di rig sngags 'chang ba de dang des ming brjod pa dang /
translated: This is the great maṇḍala of liberation, the essence of the secret mantra, the maṇḍala of liberation that is bowed to by all bodhisattvas. The reciter of the vidyā mantra, by merely uttering the name of that vidyā mantra,

original: gang dran pa tsam la sogs pa dang / lta ba dang / nyan pa dang / ming 'dzin pa yang 'khor ba'i pha rol tu brgal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dran pa tsam la sogs pa dang / lta ba dang / nyan pa dang / ming 'dzin pa yang 'khor ba'i pha rol tu brgal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: by merely recollecting it, by merely seeing it, by merely hearing it, and by merely holding the name, will cross to the far shore of saṃsāra.

original: phyir mi ldog pa nyid du sa bcu bgrod nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa nyid du sa bcu bgrod nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having traversed the ten grounds, they will attain irreversibility from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: gang zhig dkyil 'khor chen po 'di 'dra ba mngon du mthong ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i gzungs 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gsang sngags kyi tshig bzlas brjod byed pa dang / klog pa dang / dran pa dang / 'chad pa dang / lan 'ga' smyur bas mthong ba dang /
analyzed: gang zhig dkyil 'khor chen po 'di 'dra ba mngon du mthong ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i gzungs 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gsang sngags kyi tshig bzlas brjod byed pa dang / klog pa dang / dran pa dang / 'chad pa dang / lan 'ga' smyur bas mthong ba dang /
translated: Those who see such a great maṇḍala, and who recite, read, remember, explain, and see it once quickly,

original: thang gcig dang / skad cig dang / yud tsam gyis mthong ba ni /
analyzed: thang gcig dang / skad cig dang / yud tsam gyis mthong ba ni /
translated: and who see it for one moment, one instant, or one second,

original: nga dang mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: nga dang mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa yin no //
translated: are equal to me and not equal.

original: zhes smra'o // bdag ni /
analyzed: zhes smra'o // bdag ni /
translated: I say this.

original: sems can de la de bzhin gshegs pa yin par yang 'dzin @14a *//
analyzed: sems can de la de bzhin gshegs pa yin par yang 'dzin @14a *//
translated: I regard that being as a tathāgata,

original: te; 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa yin pas spyi bos dbang bskur bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: te; 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa yin pas spyi bos dbang bskur bar bgyi'o //
translated: and because of being worldly and transcendent, I will confer the crown empowerment.

original: rig sngags 'chang bas zungs shig dang / mchog ji ltar 'dod pa dang / ji ltar yid la re ba dang / bsam pa de thams cad rjes su gzung zhing sbyin par mdzad do //
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang bas zungs shig dang / mchog ji ltar 'dod pa dang / ji ltar yid la re ba dang / bsam pa de thams cad rjes su gzung zhing sbyin par mdzad do //
translated: The vidyādhara should hold it, and whatever supreme wish, whatever hope is in the mind, all that will be fulfilled and granted.

original: de'i tshe rig sngags 'chang bas yid la ji ltar bsam pa'i mchog smras na /
analyzed: de'i tshe rig sngags 'chang bas yid la ji ltar bsam pa'i mchog smras na /
translated: At that time, if the vidyādhara utters the supreme wish in his mind,

original: de thams cad sbyin par mdzad cing don yod pa'i ye shes bkod pa rnam par grol ba dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de thams cad sbyin par mdzad cing don yod pa'i ye shes bkod pa rnam par grol ba dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: all that will be granted, and he will attain the samādhi called the array of Amoghasiddhi, the stainless liberation.

original: gzhan yang gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa khrag khrig stong phrag bcu'i ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma dang mnyam pa khrag khrig stong phrag bcu'i ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, he will attain the samādhi of the ten sextillion vidyādhara buddhas equal to the sands of the Ganges River.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will travel through the sky by means of his magical power.

original: dkyil 'khor de'i dam tshig tu zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor de'i dam tshig tu zhugs pa ni /
translated: Those who have entered the samaya of that maṇḍala

original: dam tshig shes pa'i rjes su zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: dam tshig shes pa'i rjes su zhugs pa yin te /
translated: are followers of the knowledge of samaya.

original: de dag thams cad sa bcu la rab tu gnas pa yin /
analyzed: de dag thams cad sa bcu la rab tu gnas pa yin /
translated: All of them are well-established on the tenth bhūmi.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba'i phyir mi ldog pa thob par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba'i phyir mi ldog pa thob par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: they will attain irreversibility from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening;

original: lung bstan pa dang byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ba yin; de ni /
analyzed: lung bstan pa dang byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ba yin; de ni /
translated: they will attain prophecy and consecration;

original: mngal na gnas par skye ba'i tha ma ste /
analyzed: mngal na gnas par skye ba'i tha ma ste /
translated: that is the last birth in a womb;

original: phyis mngal na gnas pa'i dri mas gos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyis mngal na gnas pa'i dri mas gos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: after that they will not be tainted by the impurities of a womb.

original: shi nas bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su skye bar @14b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shi nas bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su skye bar @14b 'gyur ro //
translated: After death they will be born in the world system Sukhāvatī.

original: de padmo'i nang nas rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan par brdzus te skyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de padmo'i nang nas rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan par brdzus te skyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be miraculously born, adorned with all ornaments, from within a lotus.

original: tshe rabs kun tu tshe rabs dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe rabs kun tu tshe rabs dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will remember their former lives in all lives.

original: don yod pa'i rgyal po'i phun sum tshogs pa cho ga zhib mo'i rgyal po rnam par grol ba'i dkyil 'khor de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byang chub kyi snying po chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dam tshig chen po 'di kha ton byed na /
analyzed: don yod pa'i rgyal po'i phun sum tshogs pa cho ga zhib mo'i rgyal po rnam par grol ba'i dkyil 'khor de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byang chub kyi snying po chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dam tshig chen po 'di kha ton byed na /
translated: The king of all the rites of Amogharaaja, the mandala of liberation, the heart of enlightenment of all the Tathagatas, the turning of the wheel of the Dharma, this great vow, if one recites it,

original: phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing na byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing na byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one will see all the Tathagatas of the ten directions, who are seated at the heart of enlightenment in the Buddha-fields.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spyan sngar legs so zhes bya ba thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spyan sngar legs so zhes bya ba thob par 'gyur te /
translated: In the presence of all the Tathagatas, one will obtain the word “excellent.”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: skye ba blangs pa legs par skye ba yin pas legs so legs so //
analyzed: skye ba blangs pa legs par skye ba yin pas legs so legs so //
translated: since one has taken an excellent rebirth, excellent, excellent!

original: phyir mi ldog par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu gnas pa yin no //
translated: One will be firmly established in the irreversible, unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad dang / phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'od zer 'bum phrag bye bas mdzes par gyur cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad dang / phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'od zer 'bum phrag bye bas mdzes par gyur cing /
translated: All those tathāgatas and the blessed buddhas of the ten directions, with their hundreds of thousands of millions of light rays,

original: bsod nams kyis brgyan pa'i phyag gser gyi mdog can brkyangs nas spyi ngor phyag 'jog cing dbugs 'byin par yang mdzad do //
analyzed: bsod nams kyis brgyan pa'i phyag gser gyi mdog can brkyangs nas spyi ngor phyag 'jog cing dbugs 'byin par yang mdzad do //
translated: extend their golden hands adorned with merit and place them on the crown of one’s head, and they also give encouragement.

original: byang chub kyi snying po la thug gi bar du chos 'brel ba'i gtam mngon sum du sgrog par mdzad do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la thug gi bar du chos 'brel ba'i gtam mngon sum du sgrog par mdzad do //
translated: They proclaim the Dharma in a direct way, up until the seat of awakening.

original: tha na dkyil 'khor chen po rol mo'i @15a *//
analyzed: tha na dkyil 'khor chen po rol mo'i @15a *//
translated: Even in the great maṇḍala,🔽the sounds of music—great drums, small drums, conches, clay drums, and musical instruments—

original: sgra rnga bo che dang / rnga bran dang / dung dang / rdza rnga dang / rol mo'i sgra gang dag grag pa la sems can gang dag gis sgra de thos nas sna ba'i bu ga tsam du song ba de thams cad phyir mi ldog par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sgra rnga bo che dang / rnga bran dang / dung dang / rdza rnga dang / rol mo'i sgra gang dag grag pa la sems can gang dag gis sgra de thos nas sna ba'i bu ga tsam du song ba de thams cad phyir mi ldog par 'gyur zhing /
translated: when sentient beings hear those sounds and they enter just the nostrils, all of them will become irreversible

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: and will be established in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: tha na byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa bya'i rna bar sgra thos pa de dag thams cad kyang phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha na byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa bya'i rna bar sgra thos pa de dag thams cad kyang phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even those who are born as animals, who hear this with their ears, will not turn back from unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: In this way,

original: rnam par 'phrul pa'i cho 'phrul chen po dang ldan pa rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga mthu chen po rnam par 'phrul pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par 'phrul pa'i cho 'phrul chen po dang ldan pa rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga mthu chen po rnam par 'phrul pa yin no //
translated: it is a great magical display of emanations, a great magical display of the power of the maṇḍala of liberation.

original: rigs kyi bu pho'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu pho'am /
translated: “Noble son,

original: rigs kyi bu mo'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo'am /
translated: noble daughter,

original: dge slong ngam /
analyzed: dge slong ngam /
translated: bhikṣu,

original: dge slong ma'am /🔽dge bsnyen nam /
analyzed: dge slong ma'am / dge bsnyen nam /
translated: bhikṣuṇī,🔽upāsaka,

original: dge bsnyen ma'am /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma'am /
translated: upāsikā,

original: sems can gzhan gang yang rung ba dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gang yang rung ba dge sbyong ngam /
translated: or any other being, whether an ascetic,

original: bram ze'am / rgyal rigs sam /
analyzed: bram ze'am / rgyal rigs sam /
translated: a brahmin, a kṣatriya,🔽a vaiśya,

original: rje'u'i rigs sam /🔽dmangs rigs sam /
analyzed: rje'u'i rigs sam /🔽dmangs rigs sam /
translated: or a śūdra,

original: 'ga' zhig gi rnam par grol ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga 'di 'khor mang po'i nang du klog pa dang / sems can gang gis sgra de thos nas sgra dbyangs de dang / ming thos pa rna ba'i bu gar song bar gyur pa de dag thams cad sgrib pa dang /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi rnam par grol ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga 'di 'khor mang po'i nang du klog pa dang / sems can gang gis sgra de thos nas sgra dbyangs de dang / ming thos pa rna ba'i bu gar song bar gyur pa de dag thams cad sgrib pa dang /
translated: and any being who hears that sound, that melody, and hears the name that goes into the ear canal, all of them will be freed from obscurations

original: sdig pa mi bzad pa las bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdig pa mi bzad pa las bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and unbearable misdeeds.

original: sngon gyi sgrib pa dang / sdig pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi sgrib pa dang / sdig pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be liberated from previous obscurations and misdeeds.

original: @15b phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @15b phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will become irreversible.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sras su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sras su rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be known as the sons of all the tathāgatas.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi sras kyi thu bo yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi sras kyi thu bo yin no //
translated: They will be the foremost sons of noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: rtag par 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug grogs mdzad cing rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag par 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug grogs mdzad cing rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Noble Avalokiteśvara will always be their companion and follower.

original: rtag tu dbugs 'byin par mdzad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu dbugs 'byin par mdzad par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will always give them relief.

original: mthar byang chub kyi snying po la gnas kyi bar du rtag tu rjes su srung bar mdzad do //
analyzed: mthar byang chub kyi snying po la gnas kyi bar du rtag tu rjes su srung bar mdzad do //
translated: And they will always be protected until they reach the site of awakening.

original: sems can gang zhig dkyil 'khor de'i sa phyogs su song ste sa gzhi snang ba tsam mthong ba de dag thams cad kyang phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gang zhig dkyil 'khor de'i sa phyogs su song ste sa gzhi snang ba tsam mthong ba de dag thams cad kyang phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Any sentient beings who go to that maṇḍala site and see even just a glimpse of the ground will all become irreversible from awakening.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad bsregs shing sgrib pa thams cad las yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad bsregs shing sgrib pa thams cad las yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will burn up all their afflictions and be completely freed from all obscurations.

original: de'i sa rdul rlung gis bdas te lus la phog pa gang yin ba de dang / tha na sems can ngan pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: de'i sa rdul rlung gis bdas te lus la phog pa gang yin ba de dang / tha na sems can ngan pa yang rung ste /
translated: Any dust from that ground that is carried by the wind and touches their bodies, even for those who are evil sentient beings,

original: de dag thams cad phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba'i gnas la rab tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba'i gnas la rab tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: they will all be established in the state of irreversibility.

original: sdig pa thams cad las yongs su grol ba dang / 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rtag tu mthong ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad las yongs su grol ba dang / 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rtag tu mthong ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be completely freed from all evil deeds and will always behold the noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dgongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dgongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be contemplated by all the tathāgatas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis dbugs phyung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis dbugs phyung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All bodhisattvas will breathe a sigh of relief.

original: lha thams cad kyis srung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha thams cad kyis srung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All gods will protect [the practitioner].

original: bsod nams kyi phung po chen po yongs su bzung @16a *//🔽bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi phung po chen po yongs su bzung @16a *// bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will acquire a great heap of merit.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will possess a great root of virtue.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: In this way,

original: sgra thos pa tsam dang / ming 'dzin pa tsam gyis 'bras bu chen po thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra thos pa tsam dang / ming 'dzin pa tsam gyis 'bras bu chen po thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: merely by hearing the sound and holding the name, he will attain great results.

original: de nas rnam par grol ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi sbyin sreg gi cho ga bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rnam par grol ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi sbyin sreg gi cho ga bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, I will explain the ritual of the fire offering of the maṇḍala of liberation,

original: sdig pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad sreg cing sdug bsngal drag po las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa drag po'i rgya mtsho dang / 'khor ba las sgrol ba 'grub pa /
analyzed: sdig pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad sreg cing sdug bsngal drag po las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa drag po'i rgya mtsho dang / 'khor ba las sgrol ba 'grub pa /
translated: which burns all misdeeds and obscurations, liberates from intense suffering, and accomplishes the liberation from the ocean of intense afflictions and saṃsāra.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i gnas bla na med par dbugs 'byin par mdzad pa /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i gnas bla na med par dbugs 'byin par mdzad pa /
translated: It is the unsurpassed relief that grants the stage of non-retrogression.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i lam ston pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i lam ston pa /
translated: It is the path of the world-transcending, unsurpassed, perfect, and complete enlightenment of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' ston pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' ston pa /
translated: It is the teacher of the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: lha'i stegs sbyin sreg byas pa tsam gyi mod la the tshom med par me lha dang / dbang po dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug chen po dang / dbang phyug dang gshin rje dang / chu lha dang / lus ngan po dang / gzhon nu rnams sbyin sreg byas pa 'di tsam gyi mod la thams cad 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha'i stegs sbyin sreg byas pa tsam gyi mod la the tshom med par me lha dang / dbang po dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug chen po dang / dbang phyug dang gshin rje dang / chu lha dang / lus ngan po dang / gzhon nu rnams sbyin sreg byas pa 'di tsam gyi mod la thams cad 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the fire offering of the gods. The moment one performs the fire offering, without doubt all the gods will come: Agni, Indra, Vishnu, Mahesvara, Ishvara, Yama, Varuna, Kubera, and the Kumara gods will all come the moment one performs the fire offering.

original: the tshom med par lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / srin po dang / sha za dang / grul bum thams cad @16b 'ong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: the tshom med par lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / srin po dang / sha za dang / grul bum thams cad @16b 'ong bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Without a doubt, all the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, rākṣasas, piśācas, and kumbhāṇḍas will come.

original: de'i mod la rig sngags 'chang ba'i rkang pa gnyis la rtag tu 'dud par byed do //
analyzed: de'i mod la rig sngags 'chang ba'i rkang pa gnyis la rtag tu 'dud par byed do //
translated: Immediately, they will always bow to the feet of the practitioner of the vidyā mantras.

original: de bzhin du nyin mtshan du kun tu srung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyin mtshan du kun tu srung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, they will always protect him day and night.

original: rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / phyag na rdo rje bdag nyid chen po dang / gnod sbyin gyi dbang po chen po bcu yang phyogs bcur srung bar byed de /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / phyag na rdo rje bdag nyid chen po dang / gnod sbyin gyi dbang po chen po bcu yang phyogs bcur srung bar byed de /
translated: The Four Great Kings, the great being Vajrapāṇi, and the ten great lords of the yakṣas will protect him in the ten directions.

original: mi srun pa ma rungs pa sel cing dmyal ba dang / 'jigs pa mi bzad pa dang / dug drag po dang / sems can ma rungs pa rnams sel bar byed do //
analyzed: mi srun pa ma rungs pa sel cing dmyal ba dang / 'jigs pa mi bzad pa dang / dug drag po dang / sems can ma rungs pa rnams sel bar byed do //
translated: They will remove the unruly and wicked, and will remove the hells, the unbearable terrors, the violent poisons, and the unruly beings.

original: de ma thag tu bsod nams chen po'i lhun po dang / bsod nams chen po'i phung po bla na med pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma thag tu bsod nams chen po'i lhun po dang / bsod nams chen po'i phung po bla na med pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Immediately, a great mountain of merit and an unsurpassed heap of merit will be produced.

original: tsandan srang nyi shu dang / aa ga ru srang lnga dang / du ru ska srang bdun dang / ga bur dang / gla rtsi srang gcig gi bzhi cha re re dang / gur gum srang gcig dang // lce pog kun tu ra srang lnga dang /
analyzed: tsandan srang nyi shu dang / aa ga ru srang lnga dang / du ru ska srang bdun dang / ga bur dang / gla rtsi srang gcig gi bzhi cha re re dang / gur gum srang gcig dang // lce pog kun tu ra srang lnga dang /
translated: Twenty sarsha of sandalwood, five sarsha of agarwood, seven sarsha of duruka, one sarsha each of camphor and musk, one sarsha of saffron, five sarsha of all-pervading tagara,

original: gu gul srang bdun dang / 'di rnams gcig tu bsres te phye mar byas la kha ra dkar po dang / sbrang rtsis ril bu zho re'i tshad tsam du byas pa stong rtsa brgyad dang / yungs kar dang / 'bras yos bsres te ril bu dang bsres nas mar gyi nang du smyugs te sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: gu gul srang bdun dang / 'di rnams gcig tu bsres te phye mar byas la kha ra dkar po dang / sbrang rtsis ril bu zho re'i tshad tsam du byas pa stong rtsa brgyad dang / yungs kar dang / 'bras yos bsres te ril bu dang bsres nas mar gyi nang du smyugs te sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: seven sarsha of gugul, having mixed all these together and made them into powder, make them into pills the size of a jujube fruit with white sugar and honey, eight thousand in total, mix them with white mustard seeds and parched rice, dip them in ghee, and perform the homa.

original: shing su ra bhi dang / shing aarga dang / shing sha mya'i yam shing gi me sbar te sbyin sreg gi cho ga bya'o //
analyzed: shing su ra bhi dang / shing aarga dang / shing sha mya'i yam shing gi me sbar te sbyin sreg gi cho ga bya'o //
translated: Light a fire with sticks of suravi, arka, and shami wood, and perform the homa ritual.

original: gang dang gang gi tshe stong rtsa brgyad sbyin sreg byas na /
analyzed: gang dang gang gi tshe stong rtsa brgyad sbyin sreg byas na /
translated: At whatever time one performs the homa of the eight thousand,

original: de dang de'i tshe sdig pa dang / sgrib pa drag po @17a *//
analyzed: de dang de'i tshe sdig pa dang / sgrib pa drag po @17a *//
translated: at that time all the grave sins and obscurations

original: thams cad sreg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad sreg par 'gyur ro //
translated: will be burned.

original: de dang de'i tshe de nad thams cad las yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang de'i tshe de nad thams cad las yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time one will be completely freed from all illnesses.

original: de dang de'i tshe gcong thams cad las yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang de'i tshe gcong thams cad las yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time one will be completely freed from all consumption.🔽At that time all the sins and obscurations of all the beings of Jambudvīpa,

original: de dang de'i tshe 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can bud med dang / skyes pa dang / khye'u dang / bu mo dang / dge slong dang / bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs la sogs pa thams cad kyi sdig pa dang /🔽sgrib pa thams cad byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang de'i tshe 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can bud med dang / skyes pa dang / khye'u dang / bu mo dang / dge slong dang / bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs la sogs pa thams cad kyi sdig pa dang /🔽sgrib pa thams cad byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: women, men, boys, girls, monks, brahmins, kṣatriyas, vaiśyas, śūdras, and so forth, will be purified.

original: sdig pa thams cad dang / byur thams cad dang / gnod pa thams cad dang / 'khrug pa thams cad dang / 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa dang / g-yul 'gyed pa dang / shags 'gyed pa thams cad dang / rang gi 'khor dang / gzhan gyi 'khor gyi 'jigs pa thams cad dang /
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad dang / byur thams cad dang / gnod pa thams cad dang / 'khrug pa thams cad dang / 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa dang / g-yul 'gyed pa dang / shags 'gyed pa thams cad dang / rang gi 'khor dang / gzhan gyi 'khor gyi 'jigs pa thams cad dang /
translated: all their negative actions, all their misfortune, all their harm, all their quarrels, all their disputes, all their battles, all their arguments, all the dangers to their own retinues and all the dangers to others’ retinues,

original: phyir rgol ba'i dgras 'jigs pa thams cad dang / sems can ma rungs pa thams cad dang / rkun po dang / zol ba dang / mi rgod pa dang / gcan gzan gtum po'i 'jigs pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba'i dgras 'jigs pa thams cad dang / sems can ma rungs pa thams cad dang / rkun po dang / zol ba dang / mi rgod pa dang / gcan gzan gtum po'i 'jigs pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: all the dangers from enemies, all the dangers from wild animals, all the dangers from thieves, swindlers, brigands, and ferocious beasts will be completely pacified.

original: sems can de dag thams cad 'jigs pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can de dag thams cad 'jigs pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: All those beings will be free from fear.

original: bud med dang / skyes pa dang / khye'u dang / bu mo dang / dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs gang dag gis de'i dri tshor ba de dag thams @17b cad kyang phyir mi ldog par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bud med dang / skyes pa dang / khye'u dang / bu mo dang / dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs gang dag gis de'i dri tshor ba de dag thams @17b cad kyang phyir mi ldog par 'gyur zhing /
translated: All the women, men, boys, girls, ascetics, brahmins, kṣatriyas, vaiśyas, and śūdras who smell that scent will become irreversible from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will all be established in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: tshe brjes nas thams cad bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su 'gro bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: tshe brjes nas thams cad bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su 'gro bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: After they die, they will all go to the world system Blissful.

original: padmo'i nang nas brdzus te skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: padmo'i nang nas brdzus te skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be born miraculously in a lotus.

original: byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa rkang gnyis dang / rkang bzhi pa rnams kyis de'i dri tshor ba tsam gyis thams cad nges par phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa rkang gnyis dang / rkang bzhi pa rnams kyis de'i dri tshor ba tsam gyis thams cad nges par phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: All those who are in the animal realm, whether two-legged or four-legged, will become irreversible just by smelling that scent.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur zhing mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur zhing mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: He will not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and will fully awaken.

original: rig sngags 'chang ba de ji lta ji ltar sbyin sreg byed pa de lta de ltar de'i lus dri ma med cing yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang ba de ji lta ji ltar sbyin sreg byed pa de lta de ltar de'i lus dri ma med cing yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: The knowledge-mantra bearer, to the extent that he performs the burnt offerings, to that extent his body will be stainless and purified.

original: stong rtsa brgyad tshang na /
analyzed: stong rtsa brgyad tshang na /
translated: When he has completed eight thousand,

original: rig sngags 'chang ba'i lus 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang ba'i lus 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the knowledge-mantra bearer’s body will blaze.

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas mang po'i sku mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas mang po'i sku mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will see the bodies of many buddhas in the ten directions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku de dag gis rig sngags 'chang ba la legs so zhes bya ba'i sgra 'byin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku de dag gis rig sngags 'chang ba la legs so zhes bya ba'i sgra 'byin te /
translated: Those Tathāgata bodies will emit the sound of “Excellent!” to the knowledge-mantra bearer.

original: rig sngags 'chang ba /
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang ba /
translated: “Knowledge-mantra bearer,

original: legs so legs so //
analyzed: legs so legs so //
translated: excellent, excellent!

original: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba'i mchog /
analyzed: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba'i mchog /
translated: This is the supreme secret of all the Tathāgatas,

original: rnam par grol ba'i dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i dkyil 'khor /
translated: the maṇḍala of liberation,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin sreg gi cho ga yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin sreg gi cho ga yin no //
translated: the rite of the supramundane burnt offering.”

original: 'di ni / bdud thams cad rab tu 'joms pa'i sbyin sreg chen po'i cho ga yin no //🔽'di ni / gnod sbyin dang / srin po @18a *//
analyzed: 'di ni / bdud thams cad rab tu 'joms pa'i sbyin sreg chen po'i cho ga yin no // 'di ni / gnod sbyin dang / srin po @18a *//
translated: This is the great rite of the fire offering that completely conquers all the māras.🔽This is the great rite of the fire offering that destroys yakṣas, rākṣasas,

original: dang / 'byung po dang / brjed byed dang / bgegs dang / log 'dren tshar gcod ba'i sbyin sreg chen po'i cho ga yin no //
analyzed: dang / 'byung po dang / brjed byed dang / bgegs dang / log 'dren tshar gcod ba'i sbyin sreg chen po'i cho ga yin no //
translated: bhūtas, ḍākas, and veṭāḍas.

original: 'di ni / byang chub kyi snying por song ste chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i sbyin sreg chen po'i cho ga yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni / byang chub kyi snying por song ste chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i sbyin sreg chen po'i cho ga yin no //
translated: This is the great rite of the fire offering that goes to the seat of awakening and turns the wheel of Dharma.

original: 'di ni / byang chub kyi lam bla na med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni / byang chub kyi lam bla na med pa yin no //
translated: This is the unsurpassed path to awakening.”

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku de dag thams cad kyis phyag g-yas pa gser gyi kha dog lta bu brkyang ste rig sngags 'chang ba'i mgo'i spyi bo la phyag 'jog par mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku de dag thams cad kyis phyag g-yas pa gser gyi kha dog lta bu brkyang ste rig sngags 'chang ba'i mgo'i spyi bo la phyag 'jog par mdzad do //
translated: Then all those tathāgata bodies extended their right hands, which were the color of gold, and placed them on the crown of the vidyādhara’s head.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: Noble Avalokiteśvara was adorned with all the ornaments of his own nature.

original: don yod pa'i zhags pa dang tshangs pa'i cha byad 'chang ba /
analyzed: don yod pa'i zhags pa dang tshangs pa'i cha byad 'chang ba /
translated: He holds a noose and wears the attire of Brahmā.

original: dbu lcang lo cod pan gyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: dbu lcang lo cod pan gyis brgyan pa /
translated: His head is adorned with a topknot and a crown.

original: padma dang / mdung rtse gsum pa dang / zhags pa thogs pa /
analyzed: padma dang / mdung rtse gsum pa dang / zhags pa thogs pa /
translated: He holds a lotus, a trident, and a noose.

original: rig sngags 'chang ba'i mdun na bzhugs te bka' stsol pa /
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang ba'i mdun na bzhugs te bka' stsol pa /
translated: He stands in front of the reciter of the vidyā-mantra and speaks:

original: rig sngags 'chang ba /
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang ba /
translated: “Reciter of the vidyā-mantra,

original: khyod kyis don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po rnam par grol ba'i dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: khyod kyis don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po rnam par grol ba'i dkyil 'khor /
translated: you have accomplished the heart essence of Amoghapāśa, the maṇḍala of complete liberation,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin sreg gi cho ga chen po grub pa legs so legs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin sreg gi cho ga chen po grub pa legs so legs so //
translated: and the great rite of transcendent burnt offerings. Excellent, excellent!

original: zungs shig dang / mchog ji lta ba dang ji ltar 'dod pa de thams cad sbyin no //
analyzed: zungs shig dang / mchog ji lta ba dang ji ltar 'dod pa de thams cad sbyin no //
translated: Take hold of it, and I will grant you all the supreme and ordinary accomplishments, just as you desire.

original: de nas rig sngags 'chang bas ji ltar 'dod pa'i mchog smras na /
analyzed: de nas rig sngags 'chang bas ji ltar 'dod pa'i mchog smras na /
translated: ” Then, if the reciter of the vidyā-mantra speaks of the supreme accomplishment that he desires,

original: de thams cad thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de thams cad thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: he will obtain it all.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras @18b gzigs kyi dbang phyug gis phyag brkyang ste rig sngags 'chang ba'i mgo'i spyi bo la phyag bzhag pa dang / phyag bzhag ma thag tu rig sngags 'chang ba nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras @18b gzigs kyi dbang phyug gis phyag brkyang ste rig sngags 'chang ba'i mgo'i spyi bo la phyag bzhag pa dang / phyag bzhag ma thag tu rig sngags 'chang ba nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The noble Avalokiteśvara will extend his hand and place it on the head of the practitioner of mantras. As soon as he is touched, the practitioner of mantras will fly up into the sky.

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will travel to all the buddhafields in the ten directions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon sum du mthong ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon sum du mthong ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will attain the direct perception of all the tathāgatas.

original: phyir mi ldog pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i gnas thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i gnas thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will attain irreversibility and the stage of nonregression.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhing du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis dbang bskur ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhing du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis dbang bskur ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will attain consecration by all the tathāgatas in all the buddhafields.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhing la bsnyen bkur byas nas bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhing la bsnyen bkur byas nas bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having served all the buddhas, he will go to the world system of Sukhāvatī.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag med byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor dang bcas pa chos 'chad pa byang chub kyi snying po la thug gi bar du mngon sum du thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'od dpag med byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor dang bcas pa chos 'chad pa byang chub kyi snying po la thug gi bar du mngon sum du thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will directly perceive the Tathāgata Amitābha together with his retinue of bodhisattvas teaching the Dharma until the essence of enlightenment.

original: de nas hom khung bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas hom khung bshad par bya ste /
translated: Next, the fire pit should be explained.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin sreg gi gnas bla na med pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin sreg gi gnas bla na med pa ni /
translated: The unsurpassed site for supramundane fire offerings

original: padma kha bye ba 'dra bar byas pa /
analyzed: padma kha bye ba 'dra bar byas pa /
translated: is made to resemble an open lotus.

original: zlum po khru gsum pas dang ba'i lci ba bsres pa dang ldan par byas /
analyzed: zlum po khru gsum pas dang ba'i lci ba bsres pa dang ldan par byas /
translated: It is round, three cubits in size, and mixed with cow dung.

original: padma'i snying po la hom khung zabs su brko ba dang / thad ka kun du khru gang pa brko bar bya'o //
analyzed: padma'i snying po la hom khung zabs su brko ba dang / thad ka kun du khru gang pa brko bar bya'o //
translated: In the center of the lotus, a fire pit is dug one cubit deep and one cubit across.

original: nang du padma bcu drug pa 'bur du byas pa bzhag la tshon sna tshogs kyis padma de brgyan par bya'o //
analyzed: nang du padma bcu drug pa 'bur du byas pa bzhag la tshon sna tshogs kyis padma de brgyan par bya'o //
translated: Inside, a sixteen-petaled lotus is placed, protruding, and the lotus is adorned with various colors.

original: padma'i @19a *// phyi 'khor du dkyil 'khor gru bzhir byas la dri sna tshogs kyis gtor ba dang / brgyan par bya'o //
analyzed: padma'i @19a *// phyi 'khor du dkyil 'khor gru bzhir byas la dri sna tshogs kyis gtor ba dang / brgyan par bya'o //
translated: Around the outside of the lotus, a square maṇḍala is made, sprinkled with various scents, and adorned.

original: dkyil 'khor kun tu bum pa gang ba bzhi dang / dngul gyi snod gang ba bzhi dang / mchod yon gyi chus bkang ba gser gyi snod bzhi dang / ro sna tshogs kyi gtor ma bzhag pa ni /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor kun tu bum pa gang ba bzhi dang / dngul gyi snod gang ba bzhi dang / mchod yon gyi chus bkang ba gser gyi snod bzhi dang / ro sna tshogs kyi gtor ma bzhag pa ni /
translated: In all the maṇḍalas, four vases filled with water, four silver vessels filled with water, four golden vessels filled with water for drinking, and four bali offerings with various tastes are placed.

original: gtor ma dkar gsum rnam pa sna tshogs dang / 'bras bu rnam pa sna tshogs bzhag pa dang / dri dang me tog sna tshogs kyis gtor te phreng ba rnam pa sna tshogs dpyangs la /
analyzed: gtor ma dkar gsum rnam pa sna tshogs dang / 'bras bu rnam pa sna tshogs bzhag pa dang / dri dang me tog sna tshogs kyis gtor te phreng ba rnam pa sna tshogs dpyangs la /
translated: Three white substances, various forms, various fruits, various fragrances, and various flowers are scattered. Various garlands are hung.

original: dkyil 'khor kun tu tshon sna lnga'i ba dan gyis mda' la brgyan te gzugs pa dang / sgo bzhi cha dbye ba dang / bum pa bzhag pa ni /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor kun tu tshon sna lnga'i ba dan gyis mda' la brgyan te gzugs pa dang / sgo bzhi cha dbye ba dang / bum pa bzhag pa ni /
translated: In all the maṇḍalas, arrows are adorned with five-colored pennants and placed. The four gates are divided, and vases are placed.

original: legs par brgyan cing dri chus yongs su bkang ba bya'o //
analyzed: legs par brgyan cing dri chus yongs su bkang ba bya'o //
translated: They are well adorned and filled with scented water.

original: sgo bzhir chos smra ba shin tu brgyan pa'i stan la 'dug ste /
analyzed: sgo bzhir chos smra ba shin tu brgyan pa'i stan la 'dug ste /
translated: At the four gates, Dharma teachers sit on well-adorned seats.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bklag par bya'o //
translated: They should recite the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: grva bzhir chos smra ba chos kyi stan legs par brgyan pa la 'dug nas don yod pa'i zhags pa'i mdo sde bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: grva bzhir chos smra ba chos kyi stan legs par brgyan pa la 'dug nas don yod pa'i zhags pa'i mdo sde bklag par bya'o //
translated: In the four corners, Dharma preachers should sit on Dharma seats well adorned and recite the Amoghapāśa Sūtra.

original: gser gyi me tog dang / dngul gyi me tog dang / zangs kyi me tog dang / rin po che sna bdun gyis mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: gser gyi me tog dang / dngul gyi me tog dang / zangs kyi me tog dang / rin po che sna bdun gyis mchod par bya'o //
translated: They should make offerings with golden flowers, silver flowers, copper flowers, and the seven precious substances.

original: de nas rig sngags 'chang bas khrus byas gos gtsang ma bgos dri zhim bos bsgos te gtsang mar byas la ril bu la don yod pa'i zhags pa'i snying po brgya rtsa brgyad @19b bzlas brjod bya'o //

translated: Above those tathāgatas, in the center, there should be the three tathāgatas Vairocana, Amitābha, and Avalokiteśvara, adorned with all ornaments, seated cross-legged inside the celestial mansion.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi 'od 'dom gang pa la 'khor bar de bzhin gshegs pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan par bya /
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi 'od 'dom gang pa la 'khor bar de bzhin gshegs pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan par bya /
translated: The noble Avalokiteśvara should be one fathom in size, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nye 'khor kun tu 'od zer 'bar ba sna tshogs dang / mdung rtse gsum pa'i phreng ba bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nye 'khor kun tu 'od zer 'bar ba sna tshogs dang / mdung rtse gsum pa'i phreng ba bya'o //
translated: All around the Tathāgata, there should be various blazing light rays and garlands of tridents.

original: de nyid kyi nye 'khor du lha sum cu rtsa gnyis bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi nye 'khor du lha sum cu rtsa gnyis bya'o //
translated: Around him, there should be thirty-two gods.

original: gong gi dbus su rdo rje 'chang ba khro gnyer can rdo rje gsor bar bya'o //
analyzed: gong gi dbus su rdo rje 'chang ba khro gnyer can rdo rje gsor bar bya'o //
translated: In the center above, there should be Vajradhara, with a frown, brandishing a vajra.

original: de nas tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug dang / dbang phyug chen po dang / lha'i dbang phyug chen po dang / sum cu rtsa gsum gyi snying po'i dbang po dang / 'og min gnas kyi lha'i bu dang / dga' ldan gyi lha'i bu dang /
