original: lha rnams kyi phyi rol thog thag tu padma'i phreng ba rdo rje dang / mdung rtse gsum pas spras pa'i padma'i phreng bas kun tu 'khor bar bya /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi phyi rol thog thag tu padma'i phreng ba rdo rje dang / mdung rtse gsum pas spras pa'i padma'i phreng bas kun tu 'khor bar bya /
translated: Outside the deities, all around, one should draw a garland of lotuses adorned with vajras and tridents.

original: g-yas phyogs su 'phags ma sgrol ma skyil mo krung phyed du bcas te bzhugs pa autpa la dang / nor bu rin po che phyag na thogs pa /
analyzed: g-yas phyogs su 'phags ma sgrol ma skyil mo krung phyed du bcas te bzhugs pa autpa la dang / nor bu rin po che phyag na thogs pa /
translated: To the right, one should draw Noble Tārā, seated in the half-crossed posture, holding an utpala and a precious jewel,

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with all ornaments.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi zhal du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi zhal du blta bar bya'o //
translated: She should face Noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: de'i rgyab tu khro gnyer ma me tog sna tshogs 'chang ba /
analyzed: de'i rgyab tu khro gnyer ma me tog sna tshogs 'chang ba /
translated: Behind her, one should draw Bhṛkuṭī, holding various flowers,

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa bya'o //
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa bya'o //
translated: adorned with all ornaments.

original: g-yon du dkar ma zhas bya ba ni /
analyzed: g-yon du dkar ma zhas bya ba ni /
translated: To the left, one should draw Pāṇḍaravāsinī,

original: skyil mo krung phyed du bcas te /
analyzed: skyil mo krung phyed du bcas te /
translated: seated in the half-crossed posture,

original: bzhugs pa / kru mud dang / nor bu rin po che lag na thogs pa /
analyzed: bzhugs pa / kru mud dang / nor bu rin po che lag na thogs pa /
translated: holding a krṣṇa flower and a precious jewel,

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la blta bar bya'o //
translated: adorned with all ornaments, facing Avalokiteśvara.

original: dkar mo de'i rgyab tu padma mdzes @23a *//
analyzed: dkar mo de'i rgyab tu padma mdzes @23a *//
translated: Behind Sitātapatrā, one should draw a beautiful lotus.

original: dga' ma / me tog sna tshogs thogs pa rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan par bya'o //
analyzed: dga' ma / me tog sna tshogs thogs pa rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan par bya'o //
translated: [One should draw] Rati, holding various flowers, adorned with all ornaments.

original: lha mo sgrol ma dang / dkar mo'i 'og tu pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i lha mo thams cad kyang dbu yid tsam 'dud pa /
analyzed: lha mo sgrol ma dang / dkar mo'i 'og tu pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i lha mo thams cad kyang dbu yid tsam 'dud pa /
translated: Below Tārā and Sitātapatrā, all the goddesses of the ten perfections, their heads bowed slightly,

original: na bza' dkar po gsol ba /
analyzed: na bza' dkar po gsol ba /
translated: wearing white garments,

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan par bya'o //
translated: adorned with all ornaments.

original: g-yas phyogs su srin mo ral pa gcig ma gtum mo skyil mo krung phyed du bcas te bzhugs pa /
analyzed: g-yas phyogs su srin mo ral pa gcig ma gtum mo skyil mo krung phyed du bcas te bzhugs pa /
translated: On the right side, one should draw the rākṣasī Ekajṭī, fierce, sitting in half-lotus posture,

original: phyag bzhi la zhags pa dang / dgra sta dang / ral gri dang / rdo rje lag na thogs pa 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyag bzhi la zhags pa dang / dgra sta dang / ral gri dang / rdo rje lag na thogs pa 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la blta bar bya'o //
translated: with four arms holding a noose, axe, sword, and vajra, gazing at Noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: g-yon du pho nya mo zhal mche ba gtsigs pa /
analyzed: g-yon du pho nya mo zhal mche ba gtsigs pa /
translated: On the left side, one should draw the messenger, with a bared fang face,

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with all ornaments,

original: phyag bzhi la zhags pa dang / dgra sta dang / rdo rje dang / mdung rtse gsum pa phyag na thogs pa /
analyzed: phyag bzhi la zhags pa dang / dgra sta dang / rdo rje dang / mdung rtse gsum pa phyag na thogs pa /
translated: with four arms holding a noose, axe, vajra, and trident.

original: skyil mo krung phyed du bcas te bzhugs pa /
analyzed: skyil mo krung phyed du bcas te bzhugs pa /
translated: He sits in the half-lotus posture.

original: 'bar ba'i nang na 'jig rten dbang phyug la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'bar ba'i nang na 'jig rten dbang phyug la blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the middle of the flames, one should visualize Avalokiteśvara.

original: ri bo po ta la'i ngos kyi gseb tu klu'i rgyal po dga' bo dang / nye dga' bo dang / klu'i bu mo klu'i gnas dang bcas pa bya ste /
analyzed: ri bo po ta la'i ngos kyi gseb tu klu'i rgyal po dga' bo dang / nye dga' bo dang / klu'i bu mo klu'i gnas dang bcas pa bya ste /
translated: In the middle of the side of Mount Potala, one should visualize the nāga kings Nanda and Upananda, along with the nāga daughters and the nāga abodes.

original: me tog sna tshogs thogs shing /
analyzed: me tog sna tshogs thogs shing /
translated: They are holding various flowers🔽and are scattering them above toward Lord Avalokiteśvara.

original: gong du bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug la 'thor bar bya'o; ;ri'i smad du lha mo dpe med ma dang / lha mo ba santi dang / sa'i lha mo dang / dpal lha mo dang / lha mo 'jigs byed ma dang / sgra dbyangs ma dang /
analyzed: gong du bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug la 'thor bar bya'o; ;ri'i smad du lha mo dpe med ma dang / lha mo ba santi dang / sa'i lha mo dang / dpal lha mo dang / lha mo 'jigs byed ma dang / sgra dbyangs ma dang /
translated: At the foot of the mountain, one should visualize the goddesses Anupamā, Vasudhārā, Pṛthivī, Śrīdevī, Bhīmadevī, Sarasvatī,

original: lcags sgrog ma dang / dung @23b can ma ste /
analyzed: lcags sgrog ma dang / dung @23b can ma ste /
translated: Pāṇḍaravāsinī, and Śaṅkhinī.

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: They are all adorned with all kinds of ornaments

original: me tog sna tshogs dang / nor bu rin po che thogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: me tog sna tshogs dang / nor bu rin po che thogs pa bya'o //
translated: and are holding various flowers and precious jewels.

original: gzhal med khang gi gong du mchod rten chen po brgyad phreng bar sbrengs la mchod rten gyi rgyan ji ltar rgyan pa de ltar brgyan par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhal med khang gi gong du mchod rten chen po brgyad phreng bar sbrengs la mchod rten gyi rgyan ji ltar rgyan pa de ltar brgyan par bya'o //
translated: Above the celestial mansion, one should arrange a garland of eight great stūpas, and one should ornament the stūpas in the same way as they are ornamented.

original: mchod rten gyi 'og g-yas rol tu bcom ldan 'das byang chub kyi snying por gshegs pa la 'jig rten dbang phyug mngon du mchod pa mdzad pa bya'o //
analyzed: mchod rten gyi 'og g-yas rol tu bcom ldan 'das byang chub kyi snying por gshegs pa la 'jig rten dbang phyug mngon du mchod pa mdzad pa bya'o //
translated: To the right of the stūpa, below, one should make the Blessed One going to the seat of awakening, worshipped by the Lord of the World.

original: 'phags pa rdo rje 'chang ba phyag na rnga yab thogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rdo rje 'chang ba phyag na rnga yab thogs pa bya'o //
translated: One should make Noble Vajradhara holding a yak-tail whisk.

original: de'i 'og tu drang srong dang / lha'i bu me tog sna tshogs kyis bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu drang srong dang / lha'i bu me tog sna tshogs kyis bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa bya'o //
translated: Below him, one should make the sage and the god's son offering various flowers to the Blessed One.

original: g-yon phyogs su bcom ldan 'das chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba bya ste /
analyzed: g-yon phyogs su bcom ldan 'das chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba bya ste /
translated: On the left side, one should make the Blessed One turning the wheel of Dharma.

original: kun dga' bo dang / rdo rje 'chang ba lag na rnga yab kyis bcom ldan 'das la mngon du g-yob par bya'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bo dang / rdo rje 'chang ba lag na rnga yab kyis bcom ldan 'das la mngon du g-yob par bya'o //
translated: Ānanda and Vajradhara should be made fanning the Blessed One with yak-tail whisks.

original: g-yas su 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug don yod pa'i zhags pa bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byed pa bya'o //
analyzed: g-yas su 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug don yod pa'i zhags pa bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byed pa bya'o //
translated: To the right, one should draw Noble Avalokiteśvara, holding a noose, making offerings to the Blessed One.

original: g-yon phyogs su khro bo'i rgyal po bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byed pa bya'o //
analyzed: g-yon phyogs su khro bo'i rgyal po bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byed pa bya'o //
translated: To the left, one should draw the King of Wrathful Ones, making offerings to the Blessed One.

original: de'i 'og tu drang srong dang / lha'i tshogs bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byed pa bya'o //🔽ras kyi sku gzugs kyi g-yon dang g-yas kyi phyi rol thog thag tu de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs brgya rtsa brgyad padmo'i gdan la tshad ji lta ba bzhin du skyil mo krung bcas te bzhugs pa rgyan thams @24a *//
analyzed: de'i 'og tu drang srong dang / lha'i tshogs bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byed pa bya'o // ras kyi sku gzugs kyi g-yon dang g-yas kyi phyi rol thog thag tu de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs brgya rtsa brgyad padmo'i gdan la tshad ji lta ba bzhin du skyil mo krung bcas te bzhugs pa rgyan thams @24a *//
translated: Below them, one should draw the hosts of sages and gods making offerings to the Blessed One.

original: cad kyis brgyan par bya'o //
analyzed: cad kyis brgyan par bya'o //
translated: On the left and right sides outside the cloth painting, all around, one should draw one hundred and eight figures of the Tathāgata, seated cross-legged on lotus seats, just the right size, adorned with all ornaments.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi seng+ge'i gdan gyi zhabs drung du rig sngags 'chang ba bus mo btsugs te me tog dang / bog phor dang / bgrang phreng lag na thogs te 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la mngon du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi seng+ge'i gdan gyi zhabs drung du rig sngags 'chang ba bus mo btsugs te me tog dang / bog phor dang / bgrang phreng lag na thogs te 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la mngon du blta bar bya'o //
translated: In front of the noble Avalokiteśvara, the vidyādhara should kneel on the ground, holding flowers, a lamp, and a rosary in his hands, and look at the noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: ri mo mkhan khrus byas shing gos gtsang ma bgos te gtsang bar byas la ro sna tshogs pa'i zas dkar gsum bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: ri mo mkhan khrus byas shing gos gtsang ma bgos te gtsang bar byas la ro sna tshogs pa'i zas dkar gsum bza' bar bya'o //
translated: The painter should bathe, put on clean clothes, and purify himself, and eat the three white foods.

original: snod gsar ba gtsang ma'i nang nas tshon lhag ma ma yin pas bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: snod gsar ba gtsang ma'i nang nas tshon lhag ma ma yin pas bri bar bya'o //
translated: He should paint on a new, clean canvas, using paints that are not the remains of something else.

original: 'di yang kha zas mi gtsang ba sna tshogs dang / gos ngan pa mi gtsang ba yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang kha zas mi gtsang ba sna tshogs dang / gos ngan pa mi gtsang ba yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: He should also avoid various impure foods and dirty, poor-quality clothes.

original: tshig ngan pa dang / sems ngan pa yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshig ngan pa dang / sems ngan pa yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: He should avoid bad speech and bad thoughts.

original: chang dang / sha dang / beg tsong dang / sgog skya dang / ke'u dang 'dres pa yongs su spangs par bya'o //
analyzed: chang dang / sha dang / beg tsong dang / sgog skya dang / ke'u dang 'dres pa yongs su spangs par bya'o //
translated: alcohol, meat, garlic, onions, and leeks.

original: nyi ma re re zhing ba'i rnam lnga la reg par bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma re re zhing ba'i rnam lnga la reg par bya'o //
translated: Every day one should touch the five products of the cow.

original: dri ma dang bral zhing ser sna dang / phrag dog dang bral bar bya'o //
analyzed: dri ma dang bral zhing ser sna dang / phrag dog dang bral bar bya'o //
translated: One should be free of stains, free of stinginess and envy.

original: byams pa dang / snying rje'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la dad pa lhag par bya ste /
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / dkon mchog gsum la dad pa lhag par bya ste /
translated: One should have the superior intention of loving kindness and compassion, and have superior faith in the Three Jewels.

original: ras kyi sku gzugs bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: ras kyi sku gzugs bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should paint the cloth image.

original: ga pur dang / gla rtsis bsgos pa'i tshon sna tshogs kyis bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: ga pur dang / gla rtsis bsgos pa'i tshon sna tshogs kyis bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should paint with various dyes scented with camphor and musk.

original: dpen zhing 'du 'dzi yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dpen zhing 'du 'dzi yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: One should be in a secluded place, free from distractions.

original: rmugs pa dang / gnyid yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / gnyid yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: One should be free from sluggishness and sleep.

original: de ltar ri mo bri @24b ba ni; las legs par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ri mo bri @24b ba ni; las legs par byas pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the painting is well done.

original: zla ba yar gyi ngo la bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba yar gyi ngo la bri bar bya'o //

translated: In the same way, those who had gone to the animal realm were illuminated. All those animals, deer and birds, were freed from the animal realm and were born in the higher realms, wearing earrings of stainless moving jewels.
